generif.text: A domain within the C-terminal tail of NuMA interacts with tubulin and induces bundling and stabilisation of microtubules and leads to formation of abnormal mitotic spindles.

NuMA is cleaved differently in Jurkat T and HeLa cells, suggesting that different sets of caspases are activated in these cell lines. The normal diffuse intranuclear distribution of NuMA changed during apoptosis.
role in development of myelodi leukemia with promyelocytic features
Proteins and open reading frames with a NuMA C terminus distal portion like region were found in a diverse set of vertebrate species including mammals, birds, amphibia, and early teleost fish.
Multiple mechanisms regulate NUMA1 dynamics at spindle poles.
concluded that variations in the NuMA gene are likely responsible for the observed increased breast cancer risk
NuMA plays diverse important roles in vertebrate cells [review]
NuMA has a role in mammary epithelial differentiation by influencing the organization of chromatin.
point to the Rae1-NuMA interaction as a critical element for normal spindle formation in mitosis
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
NuMA is a structural element in maintaining nuclear integrity.
critical spindle pole-associated mechanism, called the END (Emi1/NuMA/dynein-dynactin) network, that spatially restricts APC/C activity in early mitosis
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

The entire coding region and exon-intron boundaries of NuMa were screened in 92 familial breast cancer patients & the results do not support the role of NuMA variants as breast cancer susceptibility alleles.
Kaposi's sarcoma-associated herpesvirus-encoded LANA can interact with the nuclear mitotic apparatus protein to regulate genome maintenance and segregation.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Inhibiting Crm1 in early metaphase causes the formation of excess acentriolar spindle poles containing NuMA and B23, but does not affect centrosome numbers.
The levels of urinary NMP22 and CK18 in the patients with transitional cell carcinoma of the bladder were significantly higher than those in the non-transitional cell carcinoma of the bladder.

Data suggest that pADPr provides a dynamic cross-linking function at spindle poles by extending from covalent modification sites on PARP-5a and NuMA and binding noncovalently to NuMA and that this function helps promote assembly of exactly two poles.
Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
These results suggest that NuMA may provide structural support in the interphase nucleus by contributing to the organization of chromatin.
Ric-8A and Gi alpha recruit LGN, NuMA, and dynein to the cell cortex to help orient the mitotic spindle.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Phenotype onset is correlated with NuMA-RARalpha copy number; mice with higher copy number developing disease later than those with lower copy number.

Accurate distribution of NuMA is important for oocyte maturation, zygote and embryo development in humans. Proper assembly of NuMA is likely necessary for bipolar spindle organization and human oocyte developmental competence.
NuMA is expressed in interphase nuclei of fibroblasts and oocytes.
nuclear matrix protein 22 (nuclear mitotic apparatus protein, NuMA) has a role in upper tract urothelial tumors.

During apoptotic rearrangement of interchromatin granule clusters, the nuclear matrix (NuMa rearrangement) and chromatin are closely associated. This process occurs in defined stages and depends on the activity of protein phosphatases, caspases and CAD.
Without functional NuMA, microtubules lose connection to meiosis I spindle poles, resulting in highly disorganized early spindle assembly.
Low NUMA1 is associtated with glioblastoma.
NuMA expression was upregulated in tumours, with a significant association with disease stage in mucinous EOC subtypes, lymph node involvement and patient age
Studies indicate that the Inscuteable (Insc)and NuMA are mutually exclusive interactors of LGN.
Phosphorylation of NuMA by aurora-A is important for cell survival.
Numa regulates spindle assemby in conjunction with Eg5.
Data indicate that dynein- and astral microtubule-mediated transport of Galphai/LGN/nuclear mitotic apparatus (NuMA) complex from cell cortex to spindle poles.
NuMA is required for the recruitment of cyclin-dependent kinase 8, a component of the Mediator complex and a promoter of p53-mediated p21 gene function.
ectopic expression of BRAP2 inhibits nuclear localization of HMG20A and NuMA1, and prevents nuclear envelope accumulation of SYNE2.
ectopic expression of NuMA can manipulate endogenous p53 and p21 transcriptional expression during interphase.
NuMA phosphorylation by CDK1 couples mitotic progression with cortical dynein function.
Hepatocyte Par1b defines lumen position in concert with the position of the astral microtubule anchoring complex LGN-NuMA to yield the distinct epithelial division phenotypes.
The mitosis-dependent dynamic SUMO-1 modification of NuMA might contribute to NuMA-mediated formation and maintenance of mitotic spindle poles during mitosis.
Retinoblastoma protein (pRB) have a novel function in regulating the mitotic function of NuMA and spindle organization, which are required for proper cell cycle progression.

Study finds that frictional forces increase nonlinearly with microtubule-associated proteins (MAP) velocity across microtubules and depend on filament polarity, with NuMA's friction being lower when moving toward minus ends, EB1's lower toward plus ends, and PRC1's exhibiting no directional preference.
Letter: risk factors for false positive results when using urinary NMP22 as biomarker for early detection of bladder cancer.
NuMA interacts with phosphoinositides and links the mitotic spindle with the plasma membrane.During anaphase correct NuMA localization is mediated by direct membrane phospholipid binding.

Seven NuMA isoforms generated by alternative splicing were categorized into 3 groups: long, middle and short. Both exons 15 and 16 in long NuMA were "hotspot" for alternative splicing. Lower expression of short NuMA was observed in cancer cells compared with nonneoplastic controls.

Results show that at low grade of disease, NMP22 test provided a significantly higher sensitivity for the detection of recurrent urothelial carcinoma of the bladder compared to voided urine cytology specimens.
Suppressor APC domain containing 2 negatively regulates the localization of LGN at the cell cortex, likely by competing with NuMA for its binding

Aurora-A governs the dynamic exchange between the cytoplasmic and the spindle pole-localized pools of NuMA. Aurora-A phosphorylates directly the C terminus of NuMA on three Ser residues, of which Ser1969 determines the dynamic behavior and the spindle orientation functions of NuMA.
findings reveal a direct physical link between two important regulators of mitotic progression and demonstrate the critical role of the NuMA-Astrin interaction for accurate cell division.
Chimeric proteins constructed by fusion of LANA of Kaposi's sarcoma-associated herpesvirus with the NuMA could bind with ori-P and enhance replication of an ori-P-containing plasmid.
The results show how E-cadherin instructs the assembly of the LGN/NuMA complex at cell-cell contacts, and define a mechanism that couples cell division orientation to intercellular adhesion.
Low post translational modifications of NuMA protein is associated with neoplasms.
It has been reported that the Galectin-3/NuMA interaction is functionally important for the spindle pole organization; spindle pole cohesion requires glycosylation-mediated localization of NuMA.
Short isoform of NuMA might be functioned as a putative role of tumor suppressor. Further studies should be made to illuminate the relationship between ACTN4, MYBL2, and tumor progression.

All urine samples were analyzed by voided urine and bladder washing cytology, NMP22 and UBC rapid test (qualitatively and quantitatively). The best cutoff (highest Youden index; >/=6.7 ng/ml) for the quantitative UBC was determined by receiver operating characteristic curves.
Importin-alpha/-beta regulates the NuMA functioning required for assembly of higher-order microtubule structures including the mitotic spindle.
The function of nuclear mitotic apparatus protein (NuMA) in rDNA transcription and p53-independent nucleolar stress response suggests a central role for NuMA in cellular homeostasis.
Here, the authors use quantitative imaging and laser ablation to show that NuMA targets dynactin to spindle microtubule minus-ends, localizing dynein activity there.
The p37 negatively regulates this function of PP1, resulting in lower cortical NuMA levels and correct spindle orientation.
MISP directly interacts with ezrin and that SLK/LOK-activated ezrin ensures appropriate cortical MISP levels in mitosis by competing with MISP for actin-binding sites at the cell cortex.
Knockdown of the NS1-interacting nuclear mitotic apparatus protein 1 (NUMA1) significantly reduced infectious virus yield, suggesting NUMA1 plays important roles in Influenza A virus maturation.

A mechanism involving the sequestration of 53BP1 by NuMA in the absence of DNA damage. Such a mechanism may have evolved to disable repair functions and may be a decisive factor for tumor responses to genotoxic treatments.

Study reports the crystal structure of NuMA:LGN hetero-hexamers, and unveil their role in promoting the assembly of active cortical dynein/dynactin motors that are required in orchestrating oriented divisions in polarized cells.
The authors show an interaction of Human papillomaviruses 5 and 8 oncoproteins E6 and E7 with the nuclear mitotic apparatus protein 1 (NuMA).
IFT88 controls NuMA enrichment at k-fibers minus-ends to facilitate their re-anchoring into mitotic spindles.
NuMA1 promotes axon initial segment assembly through inhibition of endocytosis.
LGN has a role in cell cortex recruitment of NuMA
NuMA promoted the initial step of spindle bipolarization in early mitosis

Study identified new genes that rescue cell death induced by BMI1 inhibitors and selected NUMA1 for follow-up studies. Results unveiled a novel mitotic mechanism underlying BMI1-associated lethality using CRISPR-Cas9 derived knockouts of NUMA1 in both HAP1 cells and non-small lung cancer cell lines and highlighted a mechanism relying on mitotic arrest upon loss of BMI1 and a new genetic resistance mechanism.
NuMA interaction with chromatin is vital for proper chromosome decondensation at the mitotic exit.
The mitotic protein NuMA plays a spindle-independent role in nuclear formation and mechanics.
Ran-GTP Is Non-essential to Activate NuMA for Mitotic Spindle-Pole Focusing but Dynamically Polarizes HURP Near Chromosomes.
Tissue Nuclear Matrix Protein Expression 22 in Various Grades and Stages of Bladder Cancer.
Nuclear IGF1R interacts with NuMA and regulates 53BP1dependent DNA doublestrand break repair in colorectal cancer.
NuMA regulates mitotic spindle assembly, structural dynamics and function via phase separation.
Mechanism of spindle pole organization and instability in human oocytes.
Diagnostic performance of nuclear matrix protein 22 and urine cytology for bladder cancer: A meta-analysis.
The Role of NMP22 and CSTB Levels in Predicting Postoperative Recurrence of Bladder Cancer.
LINC01194 recruits NUMA1 to promote ubiquitination of RYR2 to enhance malignant progression in triple-negative breast cancer.
Length-dependent poleward flux of sister kinetochore fibers promotes chromosome alignment.
NuMA deficiency causes micronuclei via checkpoint-insensitive k-fiber minus-end detachment from mitotic spindle poles.

name: nuclear mitotic apparatus protein 1
other_names: centrophilin stabilizes mitotic spindle in mitotic cells

role of ran in mitotic spindle regulation

reactome.name: Recruitment of NuMA to mitotic centrosomes

summary: This gene encodes a large protein that forms a structural component of the nuclear matrix. The encoded protein interacts with microtubules and plays a role in the formation and organization of the mitotic spindle during cell division. Chromosomal translocation of this gene with the RARA (retinoic acid receptor, alpha) gene on chromosome 17 have been detected in patients with acute promyelocytic leukemia. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Nov 2013].
